intro: Euphrasia stricta var. puberula, commonly known as the hairy eyebright, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and features small, yellowish-orange flowers with prominent yellow spots. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which contribute to its common name. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it is often found in shaded or partially shaded areas. Euphrasia stricta var. puberula is part of the Scrophulariaceae family, known for its medicinal and ornamental value.
